citations.narrative:
The water receptacles have greenish-yellow discolored and cloudy water in them with evidence of avian fecal
contamination on them. Bird droppings contain bacteria, fungi, and other potentially harmful microorganisms which can
contaminate the animal's drinking water and potentially lead to sickness and/or disease. The water receptacles are all
lacking physical barriers needed to protect the cleanliness of the water contained in them.
If potable water is not accessible to the animals at all times, it must be provided as often as necessary for the health and
comfort of the animal. Frequency of watering shall consider age, species, condition, size, and type of the animal. All water
receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary.
Correct by January 31, 2024.

There were numerous ravens flying around the facility and perching in nearby trees. There is fecal evidence that these
birds are perching on the enclosure fences and are eliminating onto and into the enclosures. Bird droppings are
noticeable everywhere and are found concentrated by the enclosure fences, water, and feed containers. Bird droppings
can harbor bacteria, fungal, and other infectious microorganisms that can be a health risk to other animals if ingested.
A safe and effective pest control program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall
be established and maintained.
Correct by February 29, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
